articles.author: Antony Ashkenaz
articles.title: Musk facing nightmare as space tourists trapped on ISS after bad weather sparks NASA fears - Express
articles.description: NASA has warned that the first all-private crew onboard the International Space Station (ISS) have been stuck in space as a result of poor weather conditions.

articles.author: Ryan Morrison
articles.title: Large Hadron Collider fires up for the first time in three years - Daily Mail
articles.description: Firing up the nearly 17 mile-long LHC under Switzerland is a complex process, requiring everything to 'work like an orchestra', especially after the extended shut down due to Covid-19.
articles.content:
The Large Hadron Collider (LHC) has been fired up again after a three year break for maintenance and upgrades with the first beam sent around the tunnel just before 10am BST this morning.

articles.title: Humans Disrupting 66 Million-Year-Old Fundamental Feature of Ecosystems – “This Hasn't Happened Before” - SciTechDaily
articles.description: Diet-size relationship found across deep time, multiple vertebrate groups. According to a new study, the U-shaped association between diet and size in modern land mammals could also stand for "universal," as the relationship covers at least 66 million years a…

articles.author: Mary Beth Griggs
articles.title: Check out NASA's latest footage of a solar eclipse on Mars - The Verge
articles.description: The Mastcam-Z camera on NASA’s Perseverance rover took this stunning video of Mars’ larger moon Phobos during a solar eclipse.
articles.content: Its the highest-quality footage of an eclipse on Mars to date

articles.title: Astronomers Discover Micronovae: A New Kind of Thermonuclear Stellar Explosion - SciTechDaily

articles.author: Ryan Morrison
articles.title: Astronomers discover immense swarms of sunspots that could lead to solar flares - Daily Mail
articles.description: Sunspots are dark regions of the Sun where it is cooler than other parts of the  surface. Solar flares originate close to these dark areas of the star.
articles.content:
A pair of massive sunspot swarms, some large enough to devour the Earth whole, have appeared on the surface of the Sun, increasing the chance of an intense solar storm.
